definition: bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: Monday may have seemed another ho-hum day on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 周一对华尔街来说似乎又是百无聊赖的一天。

sentences.english: Til boredom overtook us, and he began to speak.
sentences.chinese: 百无聊赖中，赌鬼他对我开了腔。

sentences.english: She doesn’t want to stay poked up at home but wants to go out to work.
sentences.chinese: 她不想百无聊赖地呆在家里，想出去工作。

sentences.english: Tell your child you understand about feeling lonely -- or bored.
sentences.chinese: 告诉孩子你理解孤独或百无聊赖的感受。

sentences.english: He moped around the office for a while, feeling bored.
sentences.chinese: 他在办公室闲荡了一会儿，感到百无聊赖。

sentences.english: I sat there and twiddled my thumbs.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在那里，百无聊赖地玩着手指头。

sentences.english: Since losing his job, he has often experienced a profound sense of ennui.
sentences.chinese: 他自从失业以来，常觉百无聊赖。

sentences.english: The occasion of boredom, to find a publication into the second floor of a large living room.
sentences.chinese: 百无聊赖之际，找出一本刊物，走进二楼的大客厅。

definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
to stare blankly/to be stunned/to be lost in thought
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]

pinyin: you3 yi1 da1 mei2 yi1 da1

definition: long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
